hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Fade in Stress Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, when BTC experiences a volatility breakout (daily close outside Bollinger Band ±2σ) on elevated but declining volume (volume 20% above 20-day average but down 30% from previous day), the initial breakout direction will reverse within 3 trading days 70% of the time.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stress regimes, low-conviction breakouts on declining volume often represent 'false breaks' as market participants test liquidity levels. The volatility compression indicates equilibrium, and stress-induced breaks are frequently reversed as true directional conviction is lacking.
entry_conditions: BTC daily close outside Bollinger Band (20,2) ±2σ
Current day volume < previous day volume by 30%
Breakout occurs after at least 5 days of narrowing Bollinger Band width (compression)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves further in breakout direction by 1.5x the Bollinger Band width

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If the reversal rate is below 60% over 30+ historical stress regime occurrences, or if the average loss on failed reversals exceeds the average gain on successful ones by more than 1.5x.
